item.title: K8S CSI
item.description: PersistentVolume A PersistentVolume (PV) is a piece of storage in the cluster that has been manually provisioned by an administrator, or dynamically provisioned by Kubernetes using a StorageClass. Many cluster environments have a default StorageClass installed. When a StorageClass is not specified in the PersistentVolumeClaim, the clusterâ€™s default StorageClass is used instead Local volumes can only be used as a statically created PersistentVolume. Dynamic provisioning is not supported yet
